Entries.default:
As the last of Fyonlecg's essence dissipates, the Oracle's massive eye, clouded with blood, swivels to focus on you. Its pupil seems an inky abyss.

Pain radiates from it, almost knocking you from your feet.

<ispeech>Interloper... Your presence blights - you disease...</ispeech>

Its thoughts shudder, twisting the air around you, crashing across your mind.
"I freed you from Fyonlecg. Stand down."
"Give up. I'll grant you clemency."
"Surely it's not too late to come to an understanding. We have much to offer one another."
"Time to end this!"
[Shake your head.] "You're finished."
<ispeech>You succeed - only in prolonging - your own suffering. Your ignorance.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Clemency? Hardly yours - to offer.</ispeech>
<ispeech>You invaded - Wael's very heart - and now suggest parley?</ispeech>
<ispeech>Do not think - not think us - bereft of recourse.</ispeech>

<ispeech>You - the schema - you possess them! We feel them!</ispeech>

One eyestalk focuses on your gear - and the godseed within.

<ispeech>Purify... Everything in its place.</ispeech>

The creature's tentacles flex, and you sense essence flowing between it and the musculature around you.
"Yeah, yeah I do."
"Never heard of them and don't know what you're talking about."
"Never! I'm getting them away from you!"
"The schema? Are you talking about the godseed?"
<ispeech>Return them immediately! They belong here!</ispeech>

<ispeech>What name you give them matters not!</ispeech>

Its tentacles thrash against the moist floor.
[Give it the godseed.] "Here."
"Absolutely not."

<ispeech>Most beloved. Most important.</ispeech>

Its tentacles wrap about the pieces of the godseed and draw them tightly to its body.
<ispeech>Tumor! Stain! Infection!</ispeech>

But then you sense something else.

Something deep within the thing's eye.

The oracle blinks at you as if trying to brush sleep from its many eyes.

The previous waves of pain seem to have subsided.

You open your hand to find yourself grasping a warm, pulsing shard of metal. A memento from Wael, it seems.
"I'm glad to see you returned to us with all your faculties intact." He gives you a pained smile.
"Thought about stabbing it in, well, the eye, I guess - while you were taking that nap - but, well, what if you were inside it or something?"
"You still with us, darling? You seemed more distracted than usual that time."
"Welcome back, Watcher. It is you, ac?" Her golden eyes search you.
"Ahoy, cap. Welcome back to the Deadfire." Serafen pats you on the back.
"Beloved, are you quite all right? I hate to see that haunted look in your eyes." Tekēhu rubs the back of your neck and looks you over.
"Thank Gaun you're back! You gazed into that big eyeball any longer and I was gonna get jealous!" She squeezes your hand.
"The eye's agony - you seem to have soothed it somewhat. Thankfully."
"There you are. Thought you were goin' all Edér on us for a second." He claps you on the back and grins.
"The eyeball has been watching you this whole time. I think it winked at me."
"I wanted to stab the big eye, but I was worried it might hurt you, too. I am glad I did not have to." He lightly squeezes your shoulder.
"Can we kill it now?"
<ispeech>You communed with the Obscured.</ispeech>
[Kill the Oracle.] "I'm sorry, but you have to die. It's the only way."
[Kill the Oracle.] "Your favorite god gave me the go-ahead to chop you to pieces, eyeball."
"Wael said we should go our separate ways."
"Well this is awkward. Your god said you're not allowed to kill me."
[Kill it without warning.]
"We're leaving now."
<ispeech>Go then. Leave us to our slumber.</ispeech>
<ispeech>I refuse!</ispeech>
You channel a spell directly into the creature's eye.
<ispeech>Liar!</ispeech>
"It is as if the thing's mind is opening to swallow us all!" She raises an open palm against the telepathic onslaught.
"Hylea's feathered ass! It be like a ship at sea, 'cept the ship be our minds, and the sea the bastard's dying!" Serafen grits his teeth.

<ispeech>Interloper...</ispeech>

One of the tentacles reaches weakly for you before falling limply at your feet.
"Now is not the time for your insufferable compassion, casità! Kill it or we're next."
"Then what? We let it return to tormenting its captives here?"
"This bastard don't be deserving your mercy, cap! Not after all we've seen!"
"You should destroy this creature, for the good of the Deadfire."
"That is our choice to make, fiend. Not yours."
"Your master would see us blindered and mindless for knowing too much!"
"We're a little past debating terms of mutual understanding, casità."
"We just risked our lives to defeat this creature, and now you want to strike a deal with it? This is unwise - even for you."
"I'm ready for some shuteye. How about you?" Maia sneers at the Oracle and reaches for her weapon.
"Finally! And then we can leave this disgusting hole, ja?"
"We've already dang near killed you, you dumb eyeball!"
Something that absorbs all light. All life. All knowledge and understanding.
That absorbs you.
"I give you this thing, you'll let us go? No more fighting?"
Lids close over the five eyes momentarily, before they open again, focused entirely on you.
<ispeech>An acceptable arrangement.</ispeech>
"Just curious. I'm not giving you jack."
You unholster your firearm, take aim at the center of the Oracle's eye, and pull the trigger.
You raise your bow and fire directly into the Oracle's pupil.
You bring your weapon down upon the Oracle, crushing its carapace beneath your blows.
With a single solid thrust, you end the entity's existence.
You ram your fist deep into the entity's eye.
<ispeech>Arrrrgh! Accept your dissolution, Herald of Berath!</ispeech>
<ispeech>I will - we will never free you, Watcher!</ispeech>
<ispeech>Ugh! A shackle? Shatter another, interloper!</ispeech>
<ispeech>We are loosened! Now excise the infection!</ispeech>
Accept this. An exchange. One of its tentacles produces a fleshy ring from somewhere and tosses it at your feet.
"This creature is an agent of Wael - we cannot trust it."
[Give Concelhaut to the Oracle.] "Wael wanted you to have this."
"Watcher... what game is this you're playing? Don't toy with my hopes and ambitions. I have no stomach for it."
"No games. I'm giving you the freedom to do your worst. You won't get a better offer than that."
"I killed you. It's the least that I can do."
"I just need some peace and quiet. Go. You'll be happier here."
"I don't answer to you, skull. Go on, before I change my mind."
"I cannot pretend to understand your motives, but since they align quite neatly with my own..." Concelhaut swivels to regard the Oracle.
"For the first time in this morbid and abusive perversion of companionship, I am inclined to agree." Concelhaut swivels to regard the Oracle.
The Oracle accepts Concelhaut into its tentacles, and the skull vanishes somewhere within the entity's fleshy form.
"You have no stomach, period."
"I am ready to ascend. Finally, a body that lasts."
"Sorry."
[Walk away.]

<ispeech>You - the schema - you possess them! We feel them!</ispeech>

One eyestalk focuses on your gear - and the godseed within.
"Absolutely not."
<ispeech>Tumor! Stain! Infection!</ispeech>
